intro: Diodia brasiliensis, commonly known as Brazilian nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant produces small, white or purple flowers and has oval-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Its fruit is a small, round berry that turns red when ripe. Diodia brasiliensis is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments.
